question:
The coarse cereal crops:
1. can be grown in areas of low rainfall
2. are less susceptible to soil deficiencies in comparison to other cereals
3. are generally short duration warm weather crops
Which among the above is / are correct statements?
explanation:
Coarse cereals are short duration warm weather (Kharif) crops such as Jowar (Sorghum), Bajra (Pearl Millet), Maize, Ragi (Finger Millet) etc. They are used in food, fodder, fuel; value added products and also fast food products. The coarse cereal crops:
1. can be grown in areas of low rainfall
2. are less susceptible to soil deficiencies in comparison to other cereals
3. are generally short duration warm weather crops
